ygData.subject: Re: unassigned input values for Neural Net
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Colin, Jeff and Correy, thank you for your input. The last days I have tried your mentioned ways. As I think you may be interested in the results, here

Hello Colin, Jeff and Correy,

thank you for your input. The last days I ha=
ve tried your mentioned
ways. As I think you may be interested in the resul=
ts, here they are.

It is no scientific work, but I have build some kind of=
 benchmark. I
have stopped the training after three hours and compared the =
results.

Input neurons: 625
output neurons: 15

1) Normal representations,=
 just leave the not filled values 0.0
We set this fitness to 100%

2) Use t=
he formula x =3D (x/2)+0.5 and assign 0.0 if the value is unknown:
This ver=
sion got only 89% Fitness after the training time.

3) Using additional neu=
rons for blocks that are unassigned. I have
used 61 additional neurons For =
these blocks. I have set the values of
the original neurons like in 1)
Ther=
e were still some neurons left that had no marker if they were
unassigned. =
But They were not unassigned in blocks, so I ignored the
marker for those n=
eurons.
Marker was: neuron block is not assigned =3D> 1.0
Fitness: 106%
I t=
hink it is working better, but as the network got bigger and I am
stopping =
after 3 hours, maybe this is the reason for the only slightly
improvement

=
4) Same as 3) but with the following marker:
neuron block is assigned =3D> =
1.0
Fitness: 98%

5) Using random values if the values are unassigned:
Fitn=
ess: 96%

I would say this benchmark is not very representative. Maybe my
p=
roblem is something else.

@Jeff

I have run the net on only the neurons th=
at are available every time
(never unassigned). But I got no improvement ov=
er using more data. I
am just thinking that the more data the better.

@ALL=

Maybe there is a other problem.

Changing training data during runtime:

I=
 would have not problem to let the training ran for some weeks. But
most of=
 the time when training data gets exchanged (I change the 80000
test exampl=
es every half hour - I have over billion of test cases) the
NN Fitness stop=
s. Then it increases again after the fifth or fourth
training data exchange=
. Maybe I should not change the training data
while I am in training, but I=
 think that should help. What do you think?

Calculating output:

I need a =
percentage distribution at the output. So the sum of all 15
output neurons =
is 1.00

I am doing the following (for example if there were only 4 neurons=
):

N1: -0.3
N2: -0.1
N3: 0.2
N4: 0.6

I am adding the smallest number (Abs=
(-0.3)) to all neurons plus some
extra of 0.001 so no neuron gets completel=
y 0 ( I can not use 0 in my
program).

So:
N1: 0.001
N2: 0.201
N3: 0.501
N4=
: 0.901

I take the sum of all values (1.604) and subtract every value by t=
his
 value:

N1: 0.00062
N2: 0.12468
N3: 0.31234
N4: 0.56172

So these is p=
ercentage distribution. Maybe this calculation is the
problem, is there an =
other way?
